Legal_Issue: Did the officer err in finding that Ms. Shirazi failed to satisfy the requirements under subsection 75(2) of the IRPR?
Evidence_Assessment: Officer disregarded Happy Home English School letter due to insufficient detail on duties; Avon Appliances' letter used to award 19 points for work experience
Decision_Outcome: Application denied due to insufficient points, primarily from disputed work experience assessment
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant (Ms. Shirazi) to demonstrate eligibility under immigration regulations
Credibility_Factor: Lack of sufficient detail in employment letter affecting credibility of claimed work experience
Legal_Rule: A foreign national must perform a substantial number of main duties listed in the NOC to qualify as a skilled worker
Procedural_Issue: Lack of transparency and intelligibility in the Officer's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable assessment of work experience leading to denial of permanent residence application
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision lacked transparency and intelligibility, thus procedurally unfair
Key_Evidence_Considered: Happy Home English School employment letter
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged the Officer's assessment of her work experience
Court_Result: Judicial review granted, case remitted for reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Officer's decision
Outcome: Application denied initially; judicial review successful; case remitted
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration of application by a different officer
Claimant_Status: Foreign national applying for permanent residence
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient work experience points under skilled worker category
Applicable_Process: Skilled worker permanent residence application process
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, case remitted for reevaluation
